availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Oliver D. Greene (Assistant adjutant general of the United States of America)

body.p: New York soldier. New York native. Graduate of the United States Military Academy at West Point in 1854. Served in the 2nd United States Regular Artillery as a captain.Served in the United States Volunteers under General Don Carlos Buell as a major, lieutenant colonel, and assistant adjutant general in 1861. Chief of staff of the VI Corps during the Battle of Antietam. Transferred to the Regular U.S. Army and served the remainder of the war as assistant adjutant general in the Department of the Missouri.
